1.brief: to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

2.brief: to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
near, with or among; often in general, to
to judge (officially or mentally); by extension, to intercede, pray

3.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

5.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, non-occurrence; used adverbially, not yet or before
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

6.brief: properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

7.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence

8.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
to be hostile (only active participle an opponent)
to be straight or even; figuratively, to be (causatively, to make) right, pleasant, prosperous
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

9.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate

10.brief: to be guilty; by implication to be punished or perish

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

to push off; used in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (to expel, mislead, strike, inflict, etc.)

to be (causatively, make) bitter (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to rebel (or resist; causatively, to provoke)

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in

properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to jump for joy, i.e. exult
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
